Social media circulation: The claim was widely circulated on social media platforms such as Twitter and Facebook, with multiple users sharing the video and adding their own commentary or captions.
Source verification: The video was traced back to its original source, a YouTube channel called Top Most Media, which uploaded it in April 2018. This verification was done by Alt News in 2019, confirming that the video is at least three years old.
News reports: Telugu language news outlets MIC TV and ABN Live TV reported on the incident, providing details about the location and the individuals involved. These reports helped in verifying the authenticity of the claim.
Legal charges: Two Facebook posts mentioned that one of the individuals involved in the incident, Ramesh, was charged under specific sections of the Indian Penal Code and the Information Technology Act. This information adds credibility to the claim as it indicates that legal action was taken based on the incident.
